quotes.quote: On a superhero show, you have to have people who are really human and who have the experience the audience is having.

Life is locomotion. If you're not moving you're not living. But there comes a time when you've got to stop running away from things and you've got to start running towards something. You've got to forge ahead. Keep moving even if your path isn't clear. Trust that you'll find your way.
Heroes are ordinary people who make themselves extraordinary.

Everything we have today that's cool comes from someone wanting more of something they loved in the past. Action figures, videogames, superhero movies, iPods: All are continuations of a love that wanted more.

A superhero is someone who, at some point or in some way, inspires hope or is the enemy of cynicism. Even if you bog it down with political allegory, or even if you're doing celebrity allegory. You still need to take the cynical out of it.
Every superhero has this superhero identity and a civilian identity. A lot of their lives are about code switching.
Superheroes were born in the minds of people desperate to be rescued.
We like to think of our champions and idols as superheroes who were born different from us. We don't like to think of them as relatively ordinary people who made themselves extraordinary.

Any superhero, regardless of how different they are from Superman, recalls Superman in some way. They're either pushing against Superman or reflecting Superman; there's something about them that comes from Superman.
The measure of a superhero is always his nemesis.
A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
